page.title: 04 Schools-Survey Oxford
page.content: Most schools in Oxford were state,but the Oxford High School and St. Edwards were private.On average most schools had about 14 teachers but one particularly large school had 42!Most schools in our area cater for the 9-14 age group but two upper schools were 14-18.Only one school took boarders; St.Edwards. Most schools do wear school uniform, but both Summertown and St.Edwards do not,Cherwell pupils wear uniform in the first three years,but not in the sixth- form. Only St.Edwards had school on Saturday; this was only in the morning. The amount of home-work varied from school to school. Oxford High was the oldest, and was opened in 1875.
